![Gall Gem .jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/e/ea/Gall_Gem_.jpg)| Gall Gem| Uncommon | Using the Gourd moderately increases Poison Resistance for a short duration | Defeat the enemy harassing the Shen Monkey Vendor at Bamboo Grove - Marsh of White Mist Shrine in Black Wind Mountain| Gall Gem
img_below_text:
![Laurel Buds .jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/8/8d/Laurel_Buds_.jpg)| Laurel Buds| Rare | Using the gourd moderately increases damage reduction for a short duration | Found past the Lang-Li-Guhh-Baw boss by a statue to the left of the Sandgate Village - Village Entrance shrine in Yellow Wind Ridge| Laurel Buds
![Copper Pill .jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/f/f0/Copper_Pill_.jpg)| Copper Pill| Epic | After using the gourd, the next Rock Solid cast costs no mana for a short duration | Found by a statue on the hill after the Tiger Vanguard fight at Crouching Tiger Temple - Temple Entrance in Yellow Wind Ridge| Copper Pill

img_summary: The image depicts a bamboo container holding green buds, which are likely the Laurel Buds mentioned in the following text. In the context of the game "Black Myth: Wukong," these buds are a rare item that moderately increases damage reduction for a short duration when used. The image serves to visually represent the Laurel Buds, providing players with a reference for identifying the item in the game.
